WRITING.TEXT: Don't worry, you aren't the only one. Although I did think he looked better than last year on Monday, I'm still not high on him.
What do you think it says if we end up losing?
McCoy and woodhead
That crowd sucked, the performance was awesome though.
Well, I'm glad we didn't sign him then. Alexis would have been playing striker a lot more then, and that clearly doesn't work, as we've all seen (but Wenger hasn't)

I think our spacing can be an issue as well. It's usually great until we get to the box. There's often 4 or 5 players clumped within 5-10 yards, usually on the left side and especially when Alexis plays striker because he tends to drift into that spot even if someone else is already there. This brings a lot of defenders close to that area. In theory we should have a free man on the other post but we can't get the ball to him because it's crowded and we can't work it through.
Crazy how Toure scored 20 from midfield, that's honestly unheard of

1. Victor Cruz acts like he could burn Norman, OK 2. He acts as if Norman chose to not cover AB. This is false, as you could tell how excited he was when covering him. Also, players don't decide themselves how the defense plays, there's a reason we have defensive coordinators.

Post Match Thread should be reserved for initial thoughts at the end of the game. Any other analysis should be in its own thread because it's hard to find all comments specific to one topic within the thread.
How do we feel about this?

WRITING.TITLE: OFFICIAL: Cullen Jenkins signs back with the Redskins

WRITING.TEXT: Fair enough, hopefully the Alexis at striker experiment is over now.
I bet it happens. Walcott is injured and Iwobi played a full 90 minutes. He needs to be better.
Agree with everything up to "Another invisible performance from Ozil" did you not see that pass to Iwobi that led to the goal? Ozil wasn't at his best tonight but he wasn't invisible.
PSG had the most Arsenal game I've ever seen.
nut

Wow. That was crazy. I'm confused by Wenger's decisions, but I'm also feeling like he's a genius at the same time.
Ospina was insane. If Cech had started, we would have lost.
Alexis played so much better on the wing, I hope that was the last time we'll see him at striker.
Giroud confused me, not sure how I feel about him atm.
Mustafi and Koscielny both had moments of greatness and moments of stupidity.
We didn't deserve that point at all, but I'll take it. This feels like a win.
Ospina's distribution has been sub par, but he's made some amazing saves
Ox has been horrible, that whiff perfectly characterizes his game

Cannot understand the logic in not playing Giroud
This is cancer holy shit

WRITING.TITLE: Decent write up about our defensive struggles by Keim

WRITING.TEXT: Yes, I was beyond confused at first

1. Norman had the left on lockdown, can't really remember many completions on that side of the field 2. What was essentially our 2 minute offense that we ran in the 3rd quarter looked amazing. Pass protection was great. 3. DJax and the pass catching crew looked great (this includes Thompson)
Dislikes 1. Penalties 2. Defensive Line 3. Intelligence level of Joe Barry
Ideally I'd love to see Santi, but I'm not sure that he'll have the legs for it.

How so? It's been one game and he did his part. The left side was locked down all game. And as an Eagles fan, you don't really have room to talk about failed free agent signings either, just want to put that out there.
I think we need more depth and more strength on the D-Line and he'd certainly bring it, even if he's only a two down guy.
Norman had multiple tackles and pass breakups and Compton can't be held accountable for the defensive line's fault. Our line sucks.
Norman played well, Compton looked pretty good, receivers haven't declined at all, and Matt Jones looks stronger than last year.
It's one game against one of the best QB's and one of the best WR's in the game. We never play well on Monday nights either. It will get better.

We always do this. We go into the game with a plan, which works for like 2 drives. Then when it goes to shit, we don't know what to do. When we figure it out, it ends up being too late. We need to spread the field like we did on the TD drive and focus on the pass. Penalties killed us, it's ridiculous how a center can get 2 false start penalties, just ridiculous. And our run game needs to be better. We have a bunch of huge D-Linemen who don't do anything. Obviously our defense isn't going to be great this year, so the offense has to take advantage of every opportunity we create.
After he got that pick I was thinking "maybe he'll be shutdown this game" boy was I wrong.
It's one thing to get burnt by the best receiver in the league, but not making that tackle is unacceptable, Breeland. Come on now
We're so close to getting a 2 yard loss every time they run, and it ends up being 6 or 7 every time. So frustrating
I knew our defense would be bad, I didn't know they'd be this bad...
Uh yeah, he could have knocked it away. Went right through his hands
Norman needs to be on AB the whole time or that's gonna happen.
Not satisfied with all these field goals, we need a TD, Kirk!!
Well, Matt Jones looks as mediocre as ever.
Jay went with our best option. He fucked RG3 over, I will say that, but if RG3 had been our starting QB last season, there's no way we would have won the division.
I remember when he picked Cousins, I was thinking "that's such a waste, we won't need him," interesting how things turn out.
I had Brees and Cooks, ended up winning by over 50. I'm doing great so far.
They're all the same guy

Leaning that way as well.

I think I'd go with Diggs. Rawls is banged up and will have a limited role, and we can't be sure what role Blount is going to have. I don't think I'd want to trade our best WR for him, even if djax is in the last year of his contract. There are better options in free agency imo. He's not a good locker room personality either.

Gates or Witten? I'm not big on Gates against the Chiefs this week, but I'm also not huge on Witten either. I feel like he'll be instrumental for Prescott to play well, however I don't see him being a good option fantasy wise.

I'd much rather see us go for an actual center, whether we pick one up that's a free agent or wait until the offseason. In the meantime I think Licht can hold off DT just long enough for Cousins to get a throw off, due to how fast he releases the ball.

WRITING.TEXT: Planning on starting Witten over Gates, am I crazy? Gates is playing against the Chiefs, who have a weaker secondary but still good. I feel like Prescott will be most likely to go to the reliable target in Witten in a lot of situations.

Just look at the complete 180 we've taken since then. We went from ground and pound to an air assault. Personally I'm glad we ended up with the team we have now, I feel like teams that throw the ball all over the place are more likely to succeed. Too many injury risks back then in the old system.
He'll definitely get touches, especially in the beginning of the season before he gets hurt. As a Redskins fan I like him, but not sure how much value he holds.

Yeah I'm biased but I think Cousins' ADP is ridiculously low. I predict him to be the 5th best QB this season.

He's not going to strictly be a game manager, just more of one than he was last year. He had more garbage time points than any QB last year, the whole reason he finished in the top 5 QB's. Jacksonville's defense has gotten so much better, and they won't be down nearly as much as they were last year. While Jacksonville improves, Bortles declines in a fantasy sense.
One guy has Doug, McCoy, and Rawls, with only Julio and Decker as viable WR options.
No. Bortles will be much more of a game manager this season. Langford is a lone back in Chicago, while Rawls might end up splitting carries with CMike.
Yes. Thomas's production will be much lower than past seasons this year, and Bernard will have to split carries.

I usually try to because a lot of guys in my league like to horde QB's for some reason (there's like 3 or 4 teams with 3, don't ask me why). This limits the quality of available QB's on waivers (Tannehill is the best as of right now).

No, he'll probably take over for Garcon. He's a big receiver (6'4, 190) with decent speed (4.43 40 time). A lot of analysts are saying he's the best receiver in this draft class. Drawing comparisons to A.J. Green.

WRITING.TITLE: How confident are you in our running game?
WRITING.TEXT: Although our line is looking pretty good (aside from Licht) I'm very skeptical. Kelley has shown promise thus far, however he hasn't been playing against starting defenses a whole lot. Thompson is bound to get injured at some point as well. I'd really like us to go after a free agent, preferably Forsett if he doesn't resign with the Ravens. And of course there's always Pierre Thomas.
